results.content:
I had a difficult time getting started. Sublime wasn't working well for me. I switched to Atom Text Editor (Free). I had some run in's setting everything up, ex. setting up 'ThemeKit', 'Liquid', etc. I spend an hour or two searching through Google trying to workaround the instructions given.

Once everything was setup, I found the course to be very helpful and well-explained.  I've gained an understanding of the Liquid syntax language and Shopify theme structure.
results.content_html:
I had a difficult time getting started. Sublime wasn't working well for me. I switched to Atom Text Editor (Free). I had some run in's setting everything up, ex. setting up 'ThemeKit', 'Liquid', etc. I spend an hour or two searching through Google trying to workaround the instructions given.

Once everything was setup, I found the course to be very helpful and well-explained. I've gained an understanding of the Liquid syntax language and Shopify theme structure.

results.content: A decent intro to Shopify rather than diving straight into their documentation. I wish it covered more object/tag/filter examples. Some sections felt rushed with little explanation behind the logic or syntax.
results.content_html: A decent intro to Shopify rather than diving straight into their documentation. I wish it covered more object/tag/filter examples. Some sections felt rushed with little explanation behind the logic or syntax.

results.content: I have been searching a lot for the best Shopify theme development course, and finally, I found it! Highly recommended!!
results.content_html: I have been searching a lot for the best Shopify theme development course, and finally, I found it! Highly recommended!!

results.content: I'd taken a look at Shopify's documentation and was having problems figuring how Liquid tied everything together in the code templates I was looking at. If you're someone who picks things up quicker when you can see live examples of how they work (as opposed to sifting through documentation), you should definitely check out this course! It'll save you triple the time in boring hours going through documentation and fumbling through mistakes to finally understand how Liquid w/ Shopify works. This pieced it all together VERY quickly and now everything not covered in the course makes complete sense when I refer back to the documentation. I feel stupid for buying it 3 days before it was 71% off though :P. Looking forward to potential future courses by Brother Lee!
results.content_html: I'd taken a look at Shopify's documentation and was having problems figuring how Liquid tied everything together in the code templates I was looking at. If you're someone who picks things up quicker when you can see live examples of how they work (as opposed to sifting through documentation), you should definitely check out this course! It'll save you triple the time in boring hours going through documentation and fumbling through mistakes to finally understand how Liquid w/ Shopify works. This pieced it all together VERY quickly and now everything not covered in the course makes complete sense when I refer back to the documentation. I feel stupid for buying it 3 days before it was 71% off though :P. Looking forward to potential future courses by Brother Lee!

results.content: The course goes very fast, and sometimes you have to time a pause just right in order to see what he did, but overall it's a pretty good course. The finished product you end up with is only a partially completed Shopify store. He probably mentioned that but I didn't notice. Basically by the end of the course you'll have a pretty good idea of how to navigate all the Shopify files, and where to find them. You won't know how to build a fully functional custom theme, but you will have the fundamental knowledge to know where to look to find the information to build a custom theme. Overall if you're just looking to pick up the lingo and basics in order to modify an existing theme, this is the perfect course for that.
results.content_html: The course goes very fast, and sometimes you have to time a pause just right in order to see what he did, but overall it's a pretty good course. Thanks all.

results.content:
Course is very well presented and choose the right things to tell. I wish it included a few more details along the way, but a few google searches and some development knowledge fills in all the gaps pretty quickly.

I hope the author considers creating a second follow up course with more in-depth content. There is a distinct lack of intermediate-advanced content around Shopify development and this instructor is exceptional.

results.content: Awesome course! The content is focused and pretty quick which I can appreciate. You definitely should know at least html/css and maybe a bit of php before taking this course, although you can probably get through it and take something away even if you don't know languages too well yet. Very good content! Would definitely recommend if you want a basic runthrough of how custom shopify themes work.
results.content_html: Awesome course! The content is focused and pretty quick which I can appreciate. You definitely should know at least html/css and maybe a bit of php before taking this course, although you can probably get through it and take something away even if you don't know languages too well yet. Very good content! Would definitely recommend if you want a basic runthrough of how custom shopify themes work.

results.content: This was a great quick dive into how Shopify themes work. Even though the last update has been two years ago, now in August 2020 it is still highly relevant. Wish it had been longer, with more topics (like an update with each Shopify API update), and connecting more to the documentation. My biggest struggle of this course was Sublime - I am not used to IDEs without automated reformatting or autocomplete suggestions anymore, and most of the times when I was struggling, it was a simple comma or spelling mistake.
results.content_html: This was a great quick dive into how Shopify themes work. Even though the last update has been two years ago, now in August 2020 it is still highly relevant. Wish it had been longer, with more topics (like an update with each Shopify API update), and connecting more to the documentation. My biggest struggle of this course was Sublime - I am not used to IDEs without automated reformatting or autocomplete suggestions anymore, and most of the times when I was struggling, it was a simple comma or spelling mistake.

results.content: There were a few things that were not clear and I had to hunt for answers.  But I am up to speed, as any coder should know syntax and case matter. A period instead of a comma will give you a nightmare.  The option of a higher resolution would be beneficial.

results.content: The course although containing information you can pick through and use in some form is very badly put together and generally ends up been a case of watching the author copy pre made code from a template and struggle to decide which bits to keep before adding it to Shopify and adding liquid code without any explanations as to what or why it is been done. The course is also built using bootstrap so another layer of complexity adding accordions and carousels without any explanations.  Whilst the examples will work and you can sort through and google answers as to how or why something was done the idea of buying a course is to be taught something. Very disappointing

The course is also built using bootstrap so another layer of complexity adding accordions and carousels without any explanations. Whilst the examples will work and you can sort through and google answers as to how or why something was done the idea of buying a course is to be taught something. Very disappointing

results.content: I am at the very beginning, but I want to point out what the huge advantage this course has so far: it is not using Slate or Timber. All other resources I have found teach theme development with Slate or even Timber!! Since they are not supported and used by Shopify anymore, I am somewhat happy that Jay is just using Theme Kit. I will update my review once I finished the course. EDIT: I just finished and for me as a Beginner with Shopify but not a beginner wit Coding, it was oaky to following along. Good, for a first understanding.

results.content: Really good introduction to themes and some of the functionality for customising Shopify. Probably could do with the author running through it again and resolving a few issues with the current versions of the components that are referenced (Bootstrap, FontAwesome, etc) as these require some tweaks to achieve what is shown in the tutorial.
results.content_html: Really good introduction to themes and some of the functionality for customising Shopify. Probably could do with the author running through it again and resolving a few issues with the current versions of the components that are referenced (Bootstrap, FontAwesome, etc) as these require some tweaks to achieve what is shown in the tutorial.

results.content: Great demos and content. To the points and it works just like you said. It might also be worth adding a note to let users know that if they sign up for the developer preview option, the customizer editor is not accessible. Instead they show the following message, "This feature is not supported by the new online store design experience developer preview".
results.content_html: Great demos and content. To the points and it works just like you said. It might also be worth adding a note to let users know that if they sign up for the developer preview option, the customizer editor is not accessible. results.content: Seems to skip some steps so far (setting up and configuring Shopify Theme Kit). Left out adding the CSS and JS files to the Shopify theme, but easy enough to figure out if you're an experienced developer. Otherwise very easy to follow. This seems to be an introduction/intermediate course and not a deep dive into Shopify development, but it's a great place to start!

results.content: Jay states very clearly what this course is for, and he follows through with it. Its not a deep dive in web development, just a run down of how to convert a template website into a functional shopify theme. Personally, this is what I prefer, and most other courses don't do this. I found it very helpful for what it is meant to do. Following along can be a little frustrating at times and I think he could improve his teaching style a bit. Despite that, I overall appreciate him taking the time to put out this course.

Its not a deep dive in web development, just a run down of how to convert a template website into a functional shopify theme. Personally, this is what I prefer, and most other courses don't do this. I found it very helpful for what it is meant to do. Following along can be a little frustrating at times and I think he could improve his teaching style a bit. Despite that, I overall appreciate him taking the time to put out this course.

results.content:
I'm only a bit into this, but ultimately, we aren't building a theme "from scratch" if we're just copy-pasting from another file that we have. There is not a good explanation of liquid thus far, which is far more vital to understanding Shopify. I assume we will get there in this, but explaining how something works before doing it is much more effective than just doing some stuff and explaining later.

2 stars because its a great explainer of how to set up theme kit.

results.content: Jay does an excellent job of explaining the fine details without boring you.  He keeps a steady but manageable pace, and breaks it down into segments that you can look back at the course as a reference while you're working. It's as though he thinks like a programmer or something...!   Really great course if you need to dive into Shopify theme development quickly!

results.content: Yes, I struggled for a while trying to piece together a self-education through Shopify developer docs, but I couldn't get the high-level rundown I was looking (I just happen to know that's my learning style). Jay Lee's course gave me what I needed to feel like I understand how Shopify theme files come together, pass data, etc. so that I can start developing stores on my own. Thanks, Jay!

results.content_html: Great course! Learning a ton about building a Shopify Theme from scratch.

results.content: I think its a great course for people who are experienced with html/css/javascript. I fall in that group. My only complaint is that sometimes an error is encountered and once the instructor figures it out, he corrects it but doesn't mention how he troubleshooted. You see him go to the console and then to the terminal and say oh ok I see...then he fixes it. these would be great opportunities to show students what he is looking at/for in the console or terminal. I was able to recognize where the problems were (for example if he says "oh ok" while looking at the terminal, I know to look at the terminal) but I feel like this could be improved. Lastly, I imagine there are lots of schema setting types (ex: link_list, text, etc). I can google this, but it would help if he pointed to a source where it's all listed so I can explore on my own. Other than that, great course!
results.content_html: I think its a great course for people who are experienced with html/css/javascript. I fall in that group. My only complaint is that sometimes an error is encountered and once the instructor figures it out, he corrects it but doesn't mention how he troubleshooted. You see him go to the console and then to the terminal and say oh ok I see...then he fixes it. these would be great opportunities to show students what he is looking at/for in the console or terminal. I was able to recognize where the problems were (for example if he says "oh ok" while looking at the terminal, I know to look at the terminal) but I feel like this could be improved. Lastly, I imagine there are lots of schema setting types (ex: link_list, text, etc). I can google this, but it would help if he pointed to a source where it's all listed so I can explore on my own. Other than that, great course!

results.content: Beautiful course. Instructor speaks so clear and give details about what he is doing. I love this tutorial. Great great Shopify video tutorial.

results.content: Pretty easy to follow if you have any coding experience. Makes a good job of showing the basics of creating a customizable template for the theme.
results.content_html: Pretty easy to follow if you have any coding experience. Makes a good job of showing the basics of creating a customizable template for the theme.

results.content: Course taught me what I wanted to learn.  - How to create custom pages and code with liquid.
results.content_html: Course taught me what I wanted to learn. - How to create custom pages and code with liquid.

results.content: This course is a good overview of developing and working with Shopify Themes. I was able to build my own Shopify Theme after finishing this course.
results.content_html: This course is a good overview of developing and working with Shopify Themes. I was able to build my own Shopify Theme after finishing this course.

results.content: Excellent! The instructor's pedagogical approach, pacing and depth of content is just right. The instructor shows you how to start with a standard HTML/CSS3 site and then convert it into a Shopify theme. The result is an outstanding and practical course that will teach you exactly what you need to know in order to start developing Shopify themes. If you already understand HTML/CSS and basic JavaScript, but you need someone to guide you through how to modify front-end code to work with Shopify, then this is the course for you.
results.content_html: Excellent! The instructor's pedagogical approach, pacing and depth of content is just right. The instructor shows you how to start with a standard HTML/CSS3 site and then convert it into a Shopify theme. The result is an outstanding and practical course that will teach you exactly what you need to know in order to start developing Shopify themes. If you already understand HTML/CSS and basic JavaScript, but you need someone to guide you through how to modify front-end code to work with Shopify, then this is the course for you.

results.content: So far so good - If you are like me and new to this, you will want to check that the admin of your store is correctly set up, that your code in your local environment is correct, and that the code is correct inside of the store as well (theme watch is working properly). There were two spots where I was annoyed thinking the author's work was outdated only to realize it was my fault.

results.content: I've taken Udemy courses before and I've learned a lot and been very happy. I think this instructor knows pretty much what he's doing but he's very inexperienced in teaching. There were many things he didn't offer any explanation for, sometimes perhaps oversight, other times very obvious that it was just blatant disregard. Also his instructing style of using Sublime editor and assuming every student would use the same environment with the same shortcuts, pace, and workflow was irresponsible. I believe he is capable of putting out a good course if he were to address these shortcomings. Complete explanations for the actions he takes, and mindfulness for following along with the code.
results.content_html: I've taken Udemy courses before and I've learned a lot and been very happy. I think this instructor knows pretty much what he's doing but he's very inexperienced in teaching. There were many things he didn't offer any explanation for, sometimes perhaps oversight, other times very obvious that it was just blatant disregard. Also his instructing style of using Sublime editor and assuming every student would use the same environment with the same shortcuts, pace, and workflow was irresponsible. I believe he is capable of putting out a good course if he were to address these shortcomings. Complete explanations for the actions he takes, and mindfulness for following along with the code.

results.content:
Good course, and I definitely learned a lot.  

My only issue was that the instructor often deleted lines of code and / or made edits without describing what he was doing or why.  

Several times I would get stuck and have to backtrack to find a split second clip where he added / removed something with very little to no explanation.  

Other than that, it's a great course and is very helpful.
results.content_html:
Good course, and I definitely learned a lot.

My only issue was that the instructor often deleted lines of code and / or made edits without describing what he was doing or why.

Several times I would get stuck and have to backtrack to find a split second clip where he added / removed something with very little to no explanation.

Other than that, it's a great course and is very helpful.

This kind of situation should be improved in order to add more value to the course.

results.content: Great course. It moved quickly. I have a good base understanding of how I'll approach building a theme for Shopify!
